transportAdvice: Muscat is a sprawling city where walking between attractions is generally impractical due to heat and distances, so visitors rely heavily on taxis and hired cars, which are widely available. A public bus network exists but has limited coverage of tourist areas, making private transport the most practical option for sightseeing.

weather.description: Pleasant and mild with comfortable temperatures, making it one of the best months to visit Muscat.
Warm and largely sunny with occasional light breezes, ideal for outdoor sightseeing and beach visits.
Temperatures begin to rise noticeably, but conditions remain comfortable for most outdoor activities.
Heat builds significantly and outdoor activity is best planned for early mornings or evenings.
Very hot and dry with intense sun; outdoor exploration should be limited to cooler parts of the day.
Extremely hot with rising humidity as summer sets in, making outdoor activity uncomfortable for most visitors.
Hot and humid with occasional dust haze; the heat is oppressive and outdoor time should be minimized.
Persistently hot and humid, similar to July, with little relief; indoor attractions are preferable.
Still very hot and humid as summer lingers, though conditions begin to ease slightly toward month's end.
Temperatures start to become more manageable, signaling the gradual return of pleasant travel conditions.
Noticeably cooler and comfortable, making this an excellent month for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Cool and pleasant with clear skies, one of the most enjoyable months to explore Muscat.
